column1: Topic title: Dr Wee Ka Siong   MCA Out To Win Back Seats From

column8: Happy New Year: Dr Wee handing out ang pow during the Chinese New Year open house at SJKC Yong Peng 1 in Yong Peng, Johor.MCA will double efforts to help its candidates win back all seats that traditionally belonged to it in the next general election and this includes addressing local issues.Deputy president Datuk Seri Dr Wee Ka Siong said that while national issues were important, voters were equally concerned about local issues or problems closer to their hearts.He said the party wanted to reclaim the parliamentary and state seats that it had lost to the Opposition.“We have to double our efforts to ensure our candidates win and the seats come back to us.“My advice to party candidates is don’t take them (the local people) for granted because day to day issues within their communities are of interest to them,” he said.Dr Wee was speaking to reporters du­ring a Chinese New Year open house by the Ayer Hitam MCA branch, at SJKC Yong Peng 1 on Tuesday.He said the party would also start engaging with the people to educate them on their vo­ting rights.In previous elections, many did not even know how the counting of ballot papers was done, he said.“So when there were rumours that Barisan Nasional cheated in the counting process, many believed them,” he said.He also pointed out how the Opposition claimed in the previous election that about 40,000 Bangladeshis were brought into the country to vote for Barisan.Dr Wee said there were a few cases in some Chinese dominated areas, like Cheras and Kuala Lumpur, where Malaysian voters who looked like Bangladeshis were prevented from voting by party workers from the Opposition camp.“These so-called ‘Bangladeshis’ were actually Malaysians, registered voters holding genuine MyKads,” he said.And now, the Opposition was harping about 700,000 China citizens going to be given Malaysian citizenship to vote for Barisan, Dr Wee said.He said MCA was ready to face the polls and had instructed its 191 divisions and 4,000 branches nationwide to start strengthening the election machinery.http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...s5HWfM5difOc.99
what if they MCA really win back the seats from opposition then...?

the chinese will take cue from the almost total wipeout of MCA DUN seats save for its stranglehold of pagoh by a very slim margin, this time they will be handing the seats won by DAP with a bigger margin and possible overturn pagoh and other parliament seats. only the majority johor malays are still unsure about voting opposition, namely because the problems with opposition itself. but more so, because voting for opposition is seen as a big no-no, a big betrayal to the the malay heartland. they really don't know or care about bigger picture issue like apanamaitujobsDB or somethingbut it's good to think positive, wee ka siong.
